page.title: 01Barmouth and Llanaber
page.content: Barmouth is situated on the rocky slopes of garn Govllwyn and on the sandy coastal strip adjoining the Mwddach estuary. It is a seaside resort and fishing village, catering largely for touists from the Industrial Midlands and North West. Most of the people who live in Brmouth are invovvled in the tourist trade and many are unemployed during the winter. Barmouth itself is not in the Snowddonia nationl Parkk but our map block does include some park area. This bounds the Mawddach nd has a serious problem of silting. Within the last 10 years, Spartina grass has colonised large parts of the estuary, encouraging more silting and presenting a problem to the haroubr.
